text:
A developer accidentally placed a tab character after the port number in the
properties file for a tomcat instance.  This prevented tomcat from listening on
that port, but it was difficult to track down whether tomcat was running.  Seems
like the properties-file reader could easily trim excess whitespace before
trying to use entries.
creator: jimeng@umich.edu
markt@apache.org
text:
This is really an enhancememt request. The TC4.1.x branch is in a mainteance 
mode now, but if you have a patch I would be happy to consider it.

Our real question is whether this has been fixed in version 5+.  It came up in
version 4.1.30, so that's where we reported it. But if stray whitespace in a
properties is still causing entries not to be recognized, it would help to fix
that as early as possible.  Could you mark this as Tomcat 5, if it has not been
fixed?

Thanks.
creator: jimeng@umich.edu

text:
Later versions of Tomcat have better error messages that should help but it makes sense to fix this.

I have fixed this in 7.0.x and it will be included in 7.0.9 onwards. I have also proposed it for back-port to 6.0.x and 5.5.x

Since Tomcat 4 is no longer supported, I am moving this issue to Tomcat 5.
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
The change in 7.0.x was vetoed.

Given that the error messages provided in 5.5.x onwards are sufficient to track down the error this will not be resolved as WONTFIX.
creator: markt@apache.org
